entry.title: Server Downtimes
entry.content:
My Searx server down many times. The reason is RAM isn’t enough.

So I bought a better VPS today.

Problems should be fixed.

Sorry
entry.summary: My Searx server down many times. The reason is RAM isn’t enough.

entry.title: Homepage Provider Changed
entry.content:
My home page server is totally broken. In order to make it more stable. It’s hosted on GitHub now.

repo: ZhaoCloud-net/ZhaoCloud-net.github.io
entry.summary: My home page server is totally broken. In order to make it more stable. It’s hosted on GitHub now.

entry.title: Searx Update @2021.9.14
entry.content:
My server’s RAM isn’t enough. I gave up using Docker. And reinstalled Searx at all.

For normal users. You wouldn’t realize anything. Nothing changed for you.

But there’s one thing I must tell you. Today, I found something that maybe against my no-log policy. Some parts of Searx, have the possibility to record log. Like Filtron, which protects my instance from bots, can record illegal requests after blocked them.

Especially, I’m running Searx in a new way. I’m not really sure that I’m using the best config. I need time to understand how everything working.

I don’t think your search and proxy logs are being recorded.

What I can promise to you is, this is 100%-pure Searx code. I don’t do anything bad on purpose.
entry.summary: My server’s RAM isn’t enough. I gave up using Docker. And reinstalled Searx at all.

entry.title: DNSSEC and IPV6
entry.content:
Dnssec is enabled.

Ipv6 at Searx is disabled temporarily.

entry.title: Privacy Policy and Terms of Use v2

link.title: Privacy Policy and Terms of Use v2

entry.content:
main changes:
- Homepage with CDN

Data I collect:

Home page > I don’t record logs. My CDN provider, Cloudflare, can see the traffic and log the data. It depends on their privacy policy.

Searx > no log

Data I share:

(in fact, I have nothing to share now)

I won’t sell your data forever.

Only in one situation, I may share the data with governments or others. You broke the terms of use heavily, and I work with them can prohibit injuries that haven’t occurred. There must be enough reason to believe their request is sincerely and necessary.

I’ll make these requests public. (I haven’t gotten yet)

Terms of use:

Do not hurt anyone for malicious intent.

That’s all.

Please understand, ZhaoCloud values your data and tries our best to protect your privacy. But in case of attacking, spying and intimidating, I can’t make any promise!

entry.title: Bug of Searx (Aug 4)
entry.content:
Sorry! My instance still can’t get answer from Google often. Error is [too many requests].

For normal users:

  1. You can change preferences to use other search engines.
  2. If you really need Google, Go to searx.space use another instance please.

I sincerely hope everyone fair use my services. Thank you!
entry.summary: Sorry! My instance still can’t get answer from Google often. Error is [too many requests].

entry.title: Bug of Searx (Aug 3)
entry.content:
Yesterday, I also changed my Searx server. In the past 24 hours it became unstable, and can’t get answer from Google.

I’ve noticed that and fixing. Please go to searx.space use another instance now. (UTC 9:20)

Update at UTC 9:35> it has been fixed. Everything works well now. I’ll keep watching on it.

(I guess the reason is Google banned the server’s IP. I’m changing it, and considering changing the dynamic IP regularly.)
entry.summary: Yesterday, I also changed my Searx server. In the past 24 hours it became unstable, and can’t get answer from Google.

entry.title: Homepage with CDN
entry.content:
In case of funds issues. The homepage is now running on an IPV6 only server. I have to use CDN to make it is reachable from IPV4 network. I have the duty to remind you:

My CDN provider, Cloudflare, can see the traffic and log the data. It depends on their privacy policy. I may change my privacy policy in a few days.

Also, if you visit the site when my server is down. You’ll see the Cloudflare error page. Cloudflare will leave cookies on your browser in that situation.
entry.summary: In case of funds issues. The homepage is now running on an IPV6 only server. I have to use CDN to make it is reachable from IPV4 network. I have the duty to remind you:
